questions.question: I always wondered that about like boxing or Judo, does the head movement of the person work?
Is there other kind of both on the gripping side, the footwork side, leverage, anything you can speak to?
How many bins are there in judo in your mind that you put your opponents in?
Do you know how hard it is to lose that much weight in a sauna by yourself?
Is there other people that are critical to this or is this all internal to you?
Is this just the raw genetics of the human or is there something about the system?
Does he frustrate you with certain kinds of grips and then you get pissed off and then you frustrate him?
Can you become an Olympic medalist with that kind of thinking you think or not?
Are you, when you're doing these 14 rounds, is every single one a standalone thing for you?
Like, is that difficult for you to explain who Travis Stevens is when you go to visit a doctor?
What do you think about a president of a major nation being a judo black belt?
What are some impacts that he had on your life, both on the mat and off the mat?
